file_content.text: Good luck, Jedi. My thoughts are with you.
I've completed the purifying ritual of Ki-Da. I'm ready to enter the Dark Heart.
I studied the maps. Found the location described in Valen-Da's vision. We confront Lord Fulminiss there.
The Dark Heart crawls with predators. We split up. Small groups draw less attention.
Just tell me how to get there.
Sounds good.
Your Mystic and the Mystic who discovered the purifying ritual have the same last name.
Is Valen-Da related to Ki-Da?
Da is a common Voss name. Valen-Da is defined by his visions, not family history.
He waits for us. Hurry.
Yes, we shouldn't waste any more time.
Let's go.
Splitting up leaves us vulnerable. We should stick together.
That's a bad idea.
Beasts of the Dark Heart are cunning. Attack in unison. Coordinate their efforts.
Small groups pose less threat. Monsters attack individually. Seek a quick meal. This we can survive.
Okay, we'll split up.
Makes sense.
You said yourself how dangerous the Dark Heart is. I don't want you to get hurt.
I'm worried about you.
Nor I you. We must both be careful.
You'll never survive the Dark Heart without me watching out for you.
You're too weak for this.
You underestimate me. I am a commando.
I will mark the chamber on your map. Meet there. Valen-Da has foreseen it.
Talan-De will prepare you to enter the Dark Heart. Speak to me when you are done.
The maps reveal the location described in Valen-Da's vision. We confront Lord Fulminiss there.
The Dark Heart corrupts. Commandos are trained to resist. But you will be driven mad if unprepared.
Speak to Talan-De. Here in the camp. He will prepare you for the journey.
Every second, Fulminiss gets closer to his goal. I'll go speak with Talan-De right now.
The sooner, the better.
A creature at the Gormak vault spoke to me. It said it was created in the Dark Heart by a being called Sel-Makor.
Have you heard of Sel-Makor?
During the purification ritual, I fought a being, the avatar of someone named Sel-Makor. It said he lives inside the Dark Heart.
Have you heard of Sel-Makor?
I do not know the name. Valen-Da made no mention of this entity. Sel-Makor is not our concern.
Maybe you don't realize how strong I am.
I don't need his help.
The Dark Heart is a place of an ancient evil. Its power created the Nightmare Lands. Do not underestimate it.
I will study the Gormak maps. We must find the exact location described in Valen-Da's vision.
Return after Talan-De has prepared you to enter the Dark Heart.
I have the maps. These should help us find the Dark Heart so we can stop Lord Fulminiss.
You ordered my squad to retreat. Braved the Gormak reinforcements. We owe you our lives.
I wasn't alone. You risked your lives to help me. I appreciate that.
You did your part, too.
Gracious. And a great warrior. You killed many Gormak. Like my husband.
The Gormak never posed any real threat to me. I didn't see any point in your squad throwing their lives away.
I knew I could handle it.
My squad was slaughtered. It is good their sacrifice was not in vain.
I'm here for one reason: to stop Lord Fulminiss from destroying Voss.
I did what I had to.
Many Gormak fell at your hand. You are a great warrior. Like my husband.
I didn't want your friends to die. But I needed them to hold off the reinforcements.
I'm sorry for your loss.
I do not blame you. They died serving the will of Valen-Da. Like my husband.
The rest of your squad gave their lives. But you retreated.
Yet somehow you survived. Odd.
Valen-Da's vision saw us standing together. My fate is to live. Theirs, to die. Like my husband.
You are female. An outsider. Yet you remind me of him. A great warrior. An instrument of Mystic will.
You remind me of him. Strong. Fierce. An instrument of Mystic will.
Behold the patron of glory! Eyes afire with righteous might; skin bathed in the warm blood of the enemy--witness the glory and blazing fury!
The sooner we get to the Dark Heart, the sooner we can stop Fulminiss.
We should get going.
From the way you normally talk, I would have never guessed your species could be so expressive.
Is that poetry?
We know great depth of emotion. We reveal true feelings through poetry.
Although you didn't see me fighting the Gormak, you've captured it quite nicely.
Yep. That sounds like me.
This verse honors my husband. Many songs were written celebrating his death.
The songs will have to wait.
Words won't stop Fulminiss.
Agreed. Not the time for poetry. Apologies.
Can you recite another verse?
I'd like to hear more.
His wrath rains down like fire from above. Bodies encircle him like a pyre. His hand never falters; his courage never wanes as the hordes overwhelm him.
His last thoughts turn to his true love. He feels no fear. No pain. The chill of death cannot cool his passion. The hero burns eternal.
Sounds better in Voss. Basic lacks nuance.
I prefer the direct approach, myself.
I'm not into nuance.
Of course. Time for action.
Thank you for sharing that with me.
That was beautiful.
My honor. We must go. Valen-Da waits.
I... you are welcome. We must go. Valen-Da waits for us.
The Mystics want blind obedience. These songs glorify pointless suicide missions.
That poem celebrates failure.
Outsiders do not understand the Voss.
Will they write a song about me if I live?
I don't plan on dying.
We remember those who are worthy.
I've destroyed all the generators. The shields around the king's vault are down.
We suffered many casualties. We will occupy the Gormak as long as possible.
Get your squad out of there before you lose any more people.
You've done enough. Fall back.
No. We leave, you'll fight Gormak reinforcements.
We can't fail. Buy me as much time as you can then pull out.
You're right. Keep fighting.
How long can you last?
Will you be able to make it?
Long enough. We will not let the Gormak send reinforcements.
Don't throw your lives away!
Get your squad to safety.
We will begin a fighting retreat. Get the maps. Rendezvous at the Voss camp on the border of the Nightmare Lands.
I'm about to enter the king's vault. Hold out as long as you can, then pull out.
I'll try to hurry.
You have to buy me time. We need those maps to stop Fulminiss.
This mission can't fail.
I don't care how many people you lose - keep fighting!
Just do your job!
We will battle until the end.
Get the maps. Rendezvous at the Voss camp on the border of the Nightmare Lands.
Go to Gorma-Koss. My squad will distract the Gormak. Destroy the shield generators. Get the maps from the vault.
Outsider. Your mission is done. Go now.
Wait. He helped us. We may need help again.
Wait. She helped us. We may need help again.
Tala-Reh. Know my vision. Lord Fulminiss in a dark cave. Strange symbols adorn the walls. A corrupted ritual unleashes a plague of madness that drowns Voss in blood.
You and the Jedi stand with us. Against him. Meet us in the Nightmare Lands. The Dark Heart.
The Dark Heart! Let's go as soon as possible.
Let's not keep them waiting.
Do you know this place he's talking about?
What's the Dark Heart?
The center of the Nightmare Lands. A legendary place of danger and evil.
I'm sick of chasing after these two. Let's go to the Dark Heart and end this!
Good. This is almost over.
The Dark Heart is hidden. We have no maps. The Voss shun the Nightmare Lands.
The Gormak know the Nightmare Lands. They have maps. The king is dead. The Gormak are vulnerable.
Even without their king, the Gormak are fierce warriors. We need a plan.
They're still dangerous.
The Gormak know the Nightmare Lands. The Gormak king has maps.
I doubt the Gormak will want to share. We need a plan.
We have to get those maps.
I thought they were primitive savages living in small, warring tribes.
The Gormak have a king?
The Gormak king explored the Nightmare Lands. It made him strong. Now many tribes follow him.
I was just thinking I was in the mood to kill something.
Time to slaughter some Gormak!
Scouts watch the Gormak. I will speak with them. Wait here, Outsider.
Phraken-Nal is right to be cautious. Gormak are dangerous. They killed my husband.
That must make this hard for you.
I'm sorry. I didn't know.
He was a commando. He died serving the will of the Mystics.
Was your husband a commando, too?
You were married?
He was. He died serving the will of the Mystics.
He wasn't much of a soldier, then.
He must have been weak.
He was a great warrior! He sacrificed himself to serve the will of the Mystics!
Your love for your husband musn't impair your judgment on this mission. You have to set your feelings aside.
Let go of your grief.
I'd like to hear how he died.
What happened?
Valen-Da had a vision. He sent my husband to Gorma-Koss. Alone. There he met his fate.
He challenged the Gormak king to a duel. The king refused. A hundred Gormak warriors fell on him.
Twenty died before he fell. The king sent my husband's head back to Voss-Ka. Just as Valen-Da foresaw.
If I saw a vision of someone's severed head, I think I'd tell them.
Valen-Da should've warned him.
He did. My husband knew his fate.
Why would someone throw his life away like that?
His death seems pointless.
I think your Mystic wanted you all to himself.
Valen-Da got rid of him.
You do not understand the Mystics. Valen-Da did not know me then.
His death was honored in song. Poems were written. Many were inspired. The commando ranks swelled.
I enlisted. Now I protect Valen-Da.
If your husband hadn't died, you wouldn't be here to help me stop Fulminiss.
The vision served its purpose.
Valen-Da's vision caused your husband to die!
How can you not hate him?
The Gormak killed my husband. Not Valen-Da's vision. They must pay.
Enough stories of your dead husband. We need to focus on stopping Fulminiss, remember?
We don't have time for this.
I'm not interested in your dead husband. I'm trying to stop Fulminiss from destroying Voss. Remember?
I don't care.
I understand. My husband is of the past.
Tala-Reh. Outsider. I have spoken with the scouts.
The maps are in the king's vault at Gorma-Koss. The king is dead, but an army of Gormak still guard it.
The maps are in the king's vault at Gorma-Koss. The vault is unassailable. An army of Gormak protect it.
Commandos entering Gormak territory would draw them away. Thin their numbers.
Commander, send your troops into Gormak territory as a distraction. That will give me a chance to get into the vault and steal those maps.
Sounds like a plan.
Tala-Reh's right. If you create a distraction, I can get inside the Vault and get those maps.
We need to work together.
I don't care how many Gormak are in my way--I'm going to get those maps!
I don't need your help.
Alone you will fail.
Valen-Da has decreed you must go to the Dark Heart. I must heed his words.
Tala-Reh will lead a squad of Commandos against the Gormak. You will infiltrate the King's Vault at Gorma-Koss.
If you can draw away some of the Gormak soldiers, I can get that map.
That should work.
Put someone else in charge of the squad.
Tala-Reh should come with me.
Tala-Reh knows our enemy. With her some Commandos may survive.
You better not screw this up.
Just do your part.
I will assemble the squad. Tala-Reh, explain the details.
The vault is protected by an impregnable shield. Shield generators are scattered through Gorma-Koss.
Find all the generators protecting the king's vault. Destroy them. We will speak when it is done.
Outsider. I am Commander Phraken-Nal. Tala-Reh told me your mission.
It's worse than we thought. Fulminiss used a Sith ritual to drive his apprentices insane. At the shrine, he learned a technique to make it even more powerful.
This is known. We have reports. You killed the priests at the Shrine of Healing.
They attacked me. I had no choice.
Fulminiss drove them insane.
Valen-Da knew I would be at the temple. Their blood is on his hands.
Your Mystic let this happen.
The Mystics are guided by visions. There is a purpose.
Anybody who attacks me suffers the same fate.
They got what they deserved.
We do not blame you. You walk the path of Valen-Da's vision.
This recording was left behind. It's coded so only you can play it.
Valen-Da left you a message.
The Sith could be twisting Valen-Da's visions to his own dark purpose.
Fulminiss is using him.
The truth of the Mystics cannot be bent.
You may believe everything is predestined, but I don't.
I'm not his puppet.
Denial is not truth.
In time, all will be clear.
After all that's happened, you still believe. Maybe this message from Valen-Da will help us understand what's going on.
I admire your faith.
Valen-Da left a message behind. It's coded so only you can play it.
We'll have to wait and see.
I don't put much faith in your Mystics. But Valen-Da did leave a message. It's coded so only you can play it.
I'm not holding my breath.
Only the chosen can make the pilgrimage. The Mystics have decreed it. I must wait here.
Hopefully this won't take long.
I'll be back when I'm done.
Hurry. Go to the Shrine of Healing. I must wait here.
Your pilgrimage awaits. Speak with Suva-Rak.
I'm here. Ready to enter the Shrine of Healing and stop Lord Fulminiss?
I cannot. The shrine is forbidden to me.
Make the pilgrimage alone. The guardians will open the shrine.
I will honor your customs. Tell me what to do.
If that's what I have to do.
If Fulminiss seeks to destroy all life on Voss, what at the Shrine would help him do that?
What do the Sith want there?
I do not know. Only those chosen may go to the shrine.
I thought you were sworn to protect your Mystic. Now you're going to sit by and do nothing?
So I do all the work?
Only those chosen may make the pilgrimage.
The Mystics have decreed it.
Speak to Suva-Rak. He will tell you how to enter the shrine.
He told me what I need to do.
I already spoke with him.
Just tell me where to find him.
I'll go see him now.
You're sworn to protect Valen-Da, but all these laws and traditions stand in your way. Doesn't that make you angry?
That doesn't bother you?
You can't let a law handed down by some Mystic centuries ago stop you from doing your duty!
Bend the rules. Come with me.
We obey the Mystics.
Okay, you've made your point.
What if they're wrong?
They're not infallible.
You can't just let others control your life like that!
Blind obedience is stupid.
The Mystics are never wrong.
It's obvious I can't change your mind. But we can still work together.
There's no point arguing this.
We've seen what kind of man Lord Fulminiss is. Surely you don't think Valen-Da is right to help him?
Valen-Da trusted the Sith.
A Mystic is always right.
Are all Voss this stupid, or is it just you?
This whole planet is insane!
All Voss obey the Mystics.
Suva-Rak is in the camp. Speak with him to begin your pilgrimage.
We will speak when you return from the shrine.
The journey to the shrine is arduous. I will make preparations.
Here. The location of my supply camp. Meet me there. We will continue our mission.
Called us monsters. Mad with terror.
You know how to handle yourself in combat.
You fight well.
As do you. Your martial skill is impressive.
Lord Fulminiss must have done something to destroy their minds.
That's the dark side.
He may not be to blame. Many who enter the wilds go mad.
Those Sith apprentices would have killed you if it wasn't for me.
You're lucky I was here.
Doubtful. I am a commando.
Here. A holorecorder.
Welcome back, Lord Fulminiss. The ritual preparations are complete. Is this Voss going to be our first test subject?
Valen-Da is still useful to me. The same cannot be said of you.
No! Please, don't! Ugh! Aaaaah!
The monsters. I see them. They're everywhere. They're all around me. No! No!
So, your Mystic was still alive when this holo was made.
Valen-Da is with him.
That's grim, even for a Sith Lord.
He turned on his own people?
The dark side's all about grim. I bet the Emperor loves this guy.
Fulminiss often pleased the Emperor with his ruthless cruelty.
Fulminiss destroyed the minds of his own apprentices. Now do you understand why he has to be stopped?
See what the Sith are like?
There is more.
We're done here. Take me to the Shrine of Healing.
The journey is long. We must go now.
Tell me where I can find the Shrine of Healing, so I can stop Fulminiss.
We know where they're going.
This clue seems a little too convenient to have been dropped by accident.
Where did this holo come from?
Valen-Da left the holo for me to find.
Valen-Da saw what Fulminiss is capable of, and he's still willing to help him.
Your Mystic is a traitor.
Mystics are beyond reproach.
Fulminiss is dangerous. We must work together.
We'll have a better chance if we team up.
Good idea.
First you ordered me to leave, now you want to team up?
Suddenly you want my help?
The situation changed.
I can handle this on my own. You'll just get in the way.
I don't need you.
You will fail without me.
The Shrine of Healing is sacred. A place of ancient power. Fulminiss can cause great harm there.
Not during battle!
Outsider. Why are you here?
I came here in search of a man named Lord Fulminiss.
I'm looking for a Sith.
We have the same goal. This is a problem.
I'm not going to answer any questions until you tell me your name.
Who are you?
I'm not going to answer your questions.
None of your business.
You do not trust me. This will not help.
I am Tala-Reh. You wear Jedi garb. Sith's sworn enemy.
We want none of your war. I search for Fulminiss. Do not interfere.
We both want the same thing. Maybe we should team up.
We should work together.
What business do you have with him?
Why are you looking for him?
You fear I am his ally. I am not.
If I don't find Fulminiss, all of Voss will be destroyed.
My mission is more important.
You are Jedi. He is Sith. Say anything to turn the Voss against him.
I seek Valen-Da. He is a powerful Mystic. I am sworn to protect him.
Three days ago Valen-Da left the Mystic temple with Lord Fulminiss. Neither have been seen since.
I tracked a comm signal from Lord Fulminiss to here. He could be hiding deeper inside.
They might be in this cave.
Did Lord Fulminiss take Valen-Da hostage?
He must be a prisoner.
Jedi prejudice. Valen-Da left the temple willingly.
I don't care about a single Mystic. I'm trying to save the life of everyone on Voss!
That's not my problem.
Wild claims. Say anything to disparage Sith.
You wish violence upon Lord Fulminiss.
Fulminiss has one goal - to wipe out all life on Voss. I will do what I must to stop him.
Only as a last resort.
Listen to me: all Voss are in danger. Fulminiss intends to kill everyone on this planet. I won't let that happen.
He wishes violence on you.
The Sith seek to wipe out all life on this planet. You and your people are dead if I don't stop Fulminiss.
It's what he deserves.
Your actions may harm Valen-Da. That must not be. Leave.
No! Get back, you foul monsters! You want to peel the flesh from our bones!
This doesn't have to end in violence.
Peace! Drop your weapons!
It's okay. Calm down. Nobody's here to peel off your flesh.
We're not here to hurt you.
That's right--I'll skin you alive if you don't tell me where to find your master!
Where's Fulminiss? Or else!
The beasts want to feast on our innards! Kill them before they chew out our guts!
Aaaaah!
You came. I'm glad. We must speak. Alone.
Can you give us some privacy?
Remember--you're a Jedi. That comes with certain responsibilities. And certain restrictions.
I'll be right over there if you need me. Just over there... really close by....
Don't do anything I wouldn't do. Actually, I can't think of what that might be.
I'll wait over there.
Is that an order, sir?
T7 = nearby // Jedi = call if needed
You came alone. Good.
This is difficult. You are an Outsider. But you saved me from Sel-Makor. We are connected.
My order has rules against this. Personal relationships are forbidden.
A Jedi must resist emotion.
Relationships bring healing. My husband died. Inside, I also died. Now feelings are reborn.
We stopped Fulminiss together. Destroyed Sel-Makor. You don't go through that without developing some kind of friendship.
We make a good team.
This is something more.
I know what you mean. There is a bond between us.
I feel it too.
My husband died. Inside, I died. Now feelings are reborn. I live again.
Come with me. I need you. You heal the wounds of grief. One night. That is all I ask.
Will you leave Voss? Join my quest to stop the Emperor?
What happens after that?
I cannot leave. I serve the Mystics. But tonight, I will serve you.
I'm sorry. No.
You're lonely, I know that. So, it's understandable that our friendship feels like something more than it is.
I see your pain, but I can't.
You feel only friendship? I thought... no. You are right. I was blinded by grief.
My husband is gone. I still live. Clinging to the pain does not honor him.
You are wise. Thank you, Jedi. I will remember you. Always.
Can't believe you passed that up. Remind me never to become a Jedi.
You did the right thing. And what did you say to her? She actually looks happy for a change.
I know the Jedi like to help others, but we can't waste time like this.
Helping her wasn't part of our mission, but I guess it didn't hurt. Sir.
Tala-Reh = happier // Jedi = helped her
You aren't the only one with emotional wounds. We can help each other.
We both need this.
Sounds good. I'm in.
You've convinced me.
Do you have somewhere more private?
Let's go.
I know a place. Come.
I am sorry you must leave. Last night I was at peace. I am whole.
And now we have to go back to our lives.
It was. But I have to go.
This doesn't have to end. You could join me.
Come with me.
I serve the Mystics. My place is here.
I doubt you'll ever meet another man like me.
I am pretty amazing.
That, I am sure of.
You will be remembered, Jedi. Not just in song.
About time! I was waiting here all night. Alone. I guess the Voss only go for you Jedi types.
I hope that was worth it. The Jedi Code exists for a reason, you know.
Did you have fun with your little blue friend? I hope it was worth it.
If you're done satisfying your physical needs, we should get back to stopping the Emperor.
Sir. Now that you've, uh, "achieved your objective," I suggest we get back to our primary mission.
T7 = getting worried // Jedi = gone a long time
